newsitem.title: UK: LME zinc soars to highest since October 1992.
newsitem.headline: LME zinc soars to highest since October 1992.

text.p: LME zinc prices zoomed to their highest level since October 1992 on Thursday on what dealers said was a bout of fresh fund buying.
Prices climbed to as high as the $1,320 per tonne mark, compared to Wednesday's kerb close of $1,287.
"The move started late last night as brokers covered the earlier fund interest," a trader said.

"This morning fresh fund buying is not finding any producer selling as most of Europe is shut for Ascension day," he added. Prices were now targeting the October 1992 high of $1,325 and then the September 1992 high of $1,350, analysts said.
Zinc prices have move steadily higher this year, from an early January low of $1,054.
